Description: Body sherd of Laconian, probably black-figured, pottery kylix; dull cream slip; interior: painted decoration consisting of pomegranate frieze with dots between pairs of lines; red band towards centre; exterior: lower part of frieze with oblique lines above a series of narrow black bands and one wide band with superimposed red; below, tips of rays; inscription on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B7.2)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 556, no. E28)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 396, no. E28)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 240, no. 28)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.27) (Phase 1)
